Sorry about this not being a question I hope you dont mind. To compensate, right after submitting this comment, Ill ask a question.

5.18.17  9:22 pm   Been watchin' hotewig everyday as promised. Decided to focus solely on the score without quoting lines or singing along to jingles (the new arrivals one and the Turkey one almost got me). The question: How did you get so skilled in matching sounds to visual actions? The sounds you pick for zooming, panning, an empire expanding, a picture getting smaller, even an arrow being drawn are so precise and perfect every time. Have you always just heard sounds accompanying non-auditory actions in your head? Or did you learn it from somewhere like watching cartoons, for example, which tend to do that a lot?

5.18.17  8:29 pm   maybe it's the steady quarter note bassline paired with the rollicking drums, or the way the chords resolve super cleanly and standardly, i'm not sure, but "new canaan" always gives me this air of traveling that isn't quite as present in your other songs? what i was wondering though is, do the other three songs written in a similar manner follow those listed tropes (conversely, do they have a similar feel to them)? very vague question, i'm sorry, but "new canaan" is one of my fav songs of all time and i'm really excited to hear more songs written in a similar vein! thank you!
